meanings.definition: A person who protects or defends something.
meanings.sent1: The brave guardians stood watch over the castle.
meanings.sent2: The guardians of the forest ensured all animals were safe.
meanings.sent3: The guardians of the treasure chest were actually fluffy kittens!
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse acted as a guardian, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The guardians of the city were known for their unwavering dedication.

meanings.definition: A group of people responsible for protecting or overseeing something.
meanings.sent1: The guardians of the museum kept a close eye on the valuable artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The school's guardians made sure all students arrived home safely.
meanings.sent3: The guardians of the picnic were the ants who stole the sandwiches!
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed like guardians watching over the Earth.
meanings.sent5: The guardians of the park organized regular clean-up events.

meanings.sent1: The fence acted as a guardian, keeping the garden safe from rabbits.
meanings.sent2: The password was a guardian against unauthorized access to the system.
meanings.sent3: The guardian of the cookies was a sneaky cookie jar with a lock.
meanings.sent4: The thick walls of the castle were like guardians protecting the royal family.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella was a guardian against the rain, keeping her dry on the walk.
